query: What do I need to do with the Old-Fashioned Flaky Pie Dough?
text: 1. Prepare Old-Fashioned Flaky Pie Dough according to the recipe. After rolling, folding, and dividing dough in half, roll one portion into a 14-inch round. Transfer to a parchment-lined aluminum rimmed baking sheet, cover with plastic, and refrigerate to relax and chill dough, at least 2 hours or up to 24.

query: What do I need to do with the Old-Fashioned Flaky Pie Dough? Prepare Old-Fashioned Flaky Pie Dough according to the recipe. After rolling, folding, and dividing dough in half, roll one portion into a 14-inch round. how long do I need to chill the dough for? 2 hours or up to 24 What should I do with the dough after rolling one portion into a 14-inch round? Transfer to a parchment-lined aluminum rimmed baking sheet, cover with plastic, and refrigerate to relax and chill dough, at least 2 hours or up to 24. What should I do with the peaches for the filling? Wash peaches (no need to peel) and cut into 1/2-inch slices. Measure out 18 ounces (3 cups; 510g) in a medium bowl. Enjoy any extras as a snack; do not use more or you will overcrowd the pie. Sprinkle tapioca starch over peaches and toss until well combined. what is the equivalent of 18 oz in grams? 510g what should I combine the peaches in? medium bowl That's done. What's next? Enjoy any extras as a snack; do not use more or you will overcrowd the pie. How should I arrange the peaches on the dough? Arrange peaches in a ring in the center of chilled dough, tiling slices like dominoes and leaving about a 2-inch border of dough all around. how should I arrange the peaches in the dough? dominoes what should I use to cut a series of slits in the border of the dough?
text: 3. Adjust oven rack to lower-middle position and preheat to 400°F. Arrange peaches in a ring in the center of chilled dough, tiling slices like dominoes and leaving about a 2-inch border of dough all around. Sprinkle sugar on top of peaches and finish with a pinch of salt. With a sharp knife, cut a series of slits in the border of dough, each running from fruit to edge of dough, spacing them about 5 inches apart. Fold each segment of dough over peaches, tugging gently so the edge of each segment tightly overlaps the one that came before. Refrigerate pie while you prepare egg wash, but no longer than 15 minutes.

Add onion, garlic, ginger, and chili. what do I need add with the cayenne under the half of spice mixture? cashews what do I need to add of the spices? mixture After adding the cayenne, cashews, and half of the spice mixture, what is the next step?
text: 2. Heat oil, butter, or ghee in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until melted (or until oil is shimmering). Add onion, garlic, ginger, and chili. Cook, stirring frequently, and scraping bottom of pan until golden brown and starting to burn in spots, about 10 minutes. Add cayenne, cashews, and half of spice mixture. Cook, stirring constantly until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add coconut milk and remove from heat. Scrape up any browned bits from bottom of pan.

query: How should I prepare the chickpeas for soaking?
text: 1. Rinse chickpeas and place in a large bowl. Cover with cold water, adding enough to allow the chickpeas to at least triple in volume. Cover and let stand at room temperature overnight. The next day, drain, rinse, and carefully dry chickpeas in a salad spinner.

Cover with cold water, adding enough to allow the chickpeas to at least triple in volume. Cover and let stand at room temperature overnight. The next day, drain, rinse, and carefully dry chickpeas in a salad spinner.
gold_answer: Rinse chickpeas and place in a large bowl.
target_answer: true Rinse chickpeas and place in a large bowl.
answer: Rinse chickpeas and place in a large bowl. Cover with cold water, adding enough to allow the chickpeas to at least triple in volume.

query: How should I prepare the chickpeas for soaking? Rinse chickpeas and place in a large bowl. what do I cover the chickpeas with? cold water How can I ensure the chickpeas have enough room to expand in the water? Cover with cold water, adding enough to allow the chickpeas to at least triple in volume. how do I dry the chickpeas? in a salad spinner What do I need to do with the chickpeas after they have soaked overnight? The next day, drain, rinse, and carefully dry chickpeas in a salad spinner. do I drain the chickpeas the next day? yes do I add garlic to the food processor? yes should I add salt for the bowl in this food processor? yes how long should I pulse the chickpeas? until chickpeas are very finley minced How finely should the chickpeas be minced?
text: 2. Combine chickpeas, herbs, scallions, garlic, cumin, coriander, and salt in the work bowl of a food processor. Pulse until chickpeas are very finely minced, stopping the food processor to scrape down the sides as necessary. A handful of the mixture squeezed into a ball should be able to barely hold together. If not, process a little more.

If not, process a little more.

query: Alexa for the chili gravy what do I have to set to a medium heat?
text: 1. For the Chili Gravy: Heat a heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat. Cut all the chilies open along one side, so that they can be laid flat. Working in batches, cook chilies in the skillet, pressing down with a spatula, until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 5 seconds on each side; be careful not to let chilies burn. Transfer to a large bowl and cover chilies with hot water, setting a small plate on top to keep them submerged. Let stand 30 minutes.

Place the chicken in a baking dish, ziptop bag, or a food-safe storage container with a lid. what tool do I use to prick the chicken all over? fork what do I use to score the top side of the chicken thighs? sharp knife Where should I place the chicken after scoring and pricking it? Place the chicken in a baking dish, ziptop bag, or a food-safe storage container with a lid. What is the next step after putting all the ingredients in a blender? Pulse until very smooth. what do I need to pour all over the chicken? yogurt What do I need to do after blending the ingredients? Pour the yogurt mixture all over the chicken, then gently toss to coat well. Cover the container or seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight. How can I ensure the flavors of the ingredients permeate the chicken effectively? Cover the container or seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight. How do I go about pickling the nectarines? Heat a small dry skillet over medium heat. Add the coriander seeds to the hot skillet and toast until the seeds become fragrant and start to darken slightly, about 1 minute. Transfer toasted coriander seeds to a mortar and pestle and crush to a coarse powder. what do I need to heat over medium Heat? small dry skillet what do I need to pickle? nectarines How do I know when the coriander seeds are toasted enough? <extra_id_0> 3. To Pickle the Nectarines: Heat a small dry skillet over medium heat. Add the coriander seeds to the hot skillet and toast until the seeds become fragrant and start to darken slightly, about 1 minute. Transfer toasted coriander seeds to a mortar and pestle and crush to a coarse powder.
gold_answer: Toast until the seeds become fragrant and start to darken slightly, about 1 minute.
target_answer: true Toast until the seeds become fragrant and start to darken slightly, about 1 minute.

text: 6. To Cook the Chicken: When ready to cook, position oven racks in both the bottom-middle and top-middle positions and heat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line two rimmed baking sheets with foil and spray the foil with a little oil. Spread the marinated thighs over the prepared baking sheets, 4 pieces per sheet. Bake the chicken, switching the positions of the two sheets halfway through cooking, until an instant-read thermometer registers 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the thighs and the edges are slightly browned, about 30 minutes. Remove the chicken, cover, and let it stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve the chicken with the pickled nectarines on the side.

query: what should I cook the chili gravy in?
text: 1. For the Chili Gravy: Heat a heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat. Cut all the chilies open along one side, so that they can be laid flat. Working in batches, cook chilies in the skillet, pressing down with a spatula, until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 5 seconds on each side; be careful not to let chilies burn. Transfer to a large bowl and cover chilies with hot water, setting a small plate on top to keep them submerged. Let stand 30 minutes.

query: what should I cook the chili gravy in? heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet where do I put the chilies?
text: 1. For the Chili Gravy: Heat a heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat. Cut all the chilies open along one side, so that they can be laid flat. Working in batches, cook chilies in the skillet, pressing down with a spatula, until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 5 seconds on each side; be careful not to let chilies burn. Transfer to a large bowl and cover chilies with hot water, setting a small plate on top to keep them submerged. Let stand 30 minutes.
input: Question Answering: what should I cook the chili gravy in? heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet where do I put the chilies? <extra_id_0> 1. For the Chili Gravy: Heat a heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat. Cut all the chilies open along one side, so that they can be laid flat. Working in batches, cook chilies in the skillet, pressing down with a spatula, until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 5 seconds on each side; be careful not to let chilies burn. Transfer to a large bowl and cover chilies with hot water, setting a small plate on top to keep them submerged. Let stand 30 minutes.

query: what should I cook the chili gravy in? heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet where do I put the chilies? skillet What do I need to do after cutting open the chilies?
text: 1. For the Chili Gravy: Heat a heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat. Cut all the chilies open along one side, so that they can be laid flat. Working in batches, cook chilies in the skillet, pressing down with a spatula, until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 5 seconds on each side; be careful not to let chilies burn. Transfer to a large bowl and cover chilies with hot water, setting a small plate on top to keep them submerged. Let stand 30 minutes.

Transfer to a large bowl and cover chilies with hot water, setting a small plate on top to keep them submerged. Let stand 30 minutes.

query: what should I cook the chili gravy in? heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet where do I put the chilies? skillet What do I need to do after cutting open the chilies? Working in batches, cook chilies in the skillet, pressing down with a spatula, until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 5 seconds on each side; be careful not to let chilies burn. What should I do with the chilies once they are toasted?
text: 1. For the Chili Gravy: Heat a heavy 12-inch cast iron skillet over medium heat. Cut all the chilies open along one side, so that they can be laid flat. Working in batches, cook chilies in the skillet, pressing down with a spatula, until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 5 seconds on each side; be careful not to let chilies burn. Transfer to a large bowl and cover chilies with hot water, setting a small plate on top to keep them submerged. Let stand 30 minutes.

text: 6. Pinch dough around the edge of the gata between the index finger of one hand and thumb and index finger of the other hand to form decorative points, spaced about 1 inch apart. Brush top and sides of gata evenly with egg wash. Using a fork, drag flat underside of fork across top of gata to form grooved lines in a crisscross pattern, spaced about 1 inch apart. Using a toothpick, poke 8 to 10 evenly spaced holes in top of dough, stopping when you reach the filling. Bake until evenly golden brown, 28 to 35 minutes, rotating baking sheet after 20 minutes.

query: what do I need to whisk with the yeast and the baking soda? flour what can I use to stir the butter and sugar together with? stiff rubber spatula what do I wipe out?
text: 1. For the Dough: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, yeast, baking soda, and salt. In a large bowl, using a stiff rubber spatula, vigorously stir butter and sugar together to form a uniform paste. Add flour mixture to butter mixture; wipe out bowl that had flour mixture, lightly grease with cooking spray or butter, and set aside. Using spatula followed by hands, mix flour and butter mixtures together until even, cornmeal-like mixture forms, 1 to 2 minutes.

Using spatula followed by hands, mix flour and butter mixtures together until even, cornmeal-like mixture forms, 1 to 2 minutes.

text: 1. For the Dough: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, yeast, baking soda, and salt. In a large bowl, using a stiff rubber spatula, vigorously stir butter and sugar together to form a uniform paste. Add flour mixture to butter mixture; wipe out bowl that had flour mixture, lightly grease with cooking spray or butter, and set aside. Using spatula followed by hands, mix flour and butter mixtures together until even, cornmeal-like mixture forms, 1 to 2 minutes.

The next day, drain, rinse, and carefully dry chickpeas in a salad spinner. when do I drain the chickpeas? the next day why do I put the chickpeas in the salad spinner? dry chickpeas what comes after the scallions? garlic, cumin, coriander, and salt what comes after the coriander? salt what do I pulse in the food processor? chickpeas What's the desired consistency of the mixture after processing? A handful of the mixture squeezed into a ball should be able to barely hold together. What is the purpose of putting the mixture in the refrigerator for 15 minutes? to allow time for more starch to seep out of chickpeas. This will help the balls retain their shape better once formed. what do I put into my hands? mixture How should I shape the balls out of the mixture? Using a tablespoon measure, scoop out heaping spoonfuls of the mixture into your hand. Gently shape each into a ball. what will I not be able to roll the mixture like? dough Can I roll the chickpea mixture like cookie dough when forming the balls? you will not be able to roll the mixture like cookie dough; this is okay. how do I check the oil temperature? <extra_id_0> 4. When all the balls have been formed, fill a deep cast iron, carbon steel, or nonstick skillet or Dutch oven with 3/4 inch of oil. Heat over high heat until oil registers 375°F on an instant-read thermometer. Carefully lower chickpea balls into oil one at a time, allowing a little space between each ball and cooking in batches if necessary. Adjust heat as necessary to maintain a temperature of between 350 and 375°F. Allow to cook undisturbed until well browned on bottom sides, then carefully flip balls with a fork until browned on second side, about 4 minutes total. Transfer cooked chickpea balls to a paper towel–lined plate and season with salt. Repeat with remaining chickpea balls.

text: 6. To Cook the Chicken: When ready to cook, position oven racks in both the bottom-middle and top-middle positions and heat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line two rimmed baking sheets with foil and spray the foil with a little oil. Spread the marinated thighs over the prepared baking sheets, 4 pieces per sheet. Bake the chicken, switching the positions of the two sheets halfway through cooking, until an instant-read thermometer registers 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the thighs and the edges are slightly browned, about 30 minutes. Remove the chicken, cover, and let it stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve the chicken with the pickled nectarines on the side.
